thread.title: ASUS ZenFone 3S Max with 5,000mAh battery launched for Rs 14,999
thread.title_full: ASUS ZenFone 3S Max with 5,000mAh battery launched for Rs 14,999

title: ASUS ZenFone 3S Max with 5,000mAh battery launched for Rs 14,999
text:
ASUS ZenFone 3S Max with 5,000mAh battery launched for Rs 14,999 ASUS ZenFone 3S Max with 5,000mAh battery launched for Rs 14,999 By - February 7, 2017 “The ZenFone 3S Max offers 28 hours of talk time and 34 days of standby time” 
ASUS has launched the ZenFone 3S Max in India, the successor to last year’s ZenFone 3 Max ( review ) . Similar to the ZenFone 3 Max, the 3S Max is also a battery-centric smartphone featuring a beefy 5,000mAh pack. The battery is rated to deliver 28 hours of talk time on 3G networks, 28 hours of web browsing over Wi-Fi and 34 days of standby time on 4G networks. The phone also supports reverse charging, allowing it to be used it as a power bank to charge other devices. 
The ASUS ZenFone 3S Max ( first impressions ) features a metal unibody design and a fingerprint sensor embedded into its home button. The phone features a 5.2-inch HD display with 2.5D curved glass. It is powered by a 1.5GHz octa-core MediaTek MT6750 processor, mated to 3GB of RAM. It comes with 32GB of internal memory, further expandable by inserting a microSD card. Software-wise, it boots Android Nougat out of the box. 
The ZenFone 3S Max comes with a 13-megapixel primary shooter with a dual-LED flash. For selfies and video calling, it gets an 8-megapixel secondary snapper. In terms of connectivity, it offers 4G, VoLTE, dual-SIM slots, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and A-GPS. 
The ASUS ZenFone 3S Max has been priced at Rs 14,999, and will be available in two hues – black and gold. It will be available via major brick and mortar stores across the country and on e-commerce portals starting today. Facebook Comments
